1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonas Peter Ellwart Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not then perofmr 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed. No contact with victim or victim's immediate family.
Sex Offender Treatment. Cognitive Intervention. Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept. Take medications as prescribed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on may 7, 2019, that:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgments are summarily affirmed pursuant to WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that attorney Eric L. Bauer is felieved of further representing Jonas Ellwart, SR. in this matter. See WIS. STAT.RULE 809.32(3). 
*CERTIFIED*

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:02 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF1192 AND 16CF200. 
State appears by DA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman. 
Parties have received copies of PSI. VRCW. 
COURT notes 12 page letter from deft. 
Atty Bachman notes deft wishes to proceed today.  
Atty Bachman notes addition/corrections to PSI. 
State reads statement of C.C. 
Ex. 1 played for the Court. 
COURT ORDERS Ex. 1 sealed. 
T.F. makes statement. 
J.L. makes statement. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF1192: Ct. 1>>20 years imprisonment - 8 years IC and 12 years ES - with 133 days sentence credit. 
In 16CF200: Ct. 1>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - with 133 days sentence credit. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of ES on both>>Absolutely NO contact with victim or victim's immediate family; AODA and follow through; Sex Offender Treatment; Cognitive Intervention; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except prescriptions taken as prescribed; take medications as prescribed; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 

COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the deft NOT eligible for CIP or SAP. 
COURT allows counsel to retain copies of PSI and directs them to maintain their confidentiality. 
COURT remands deft into custody of MCSD for transport to WSPS. 

Adj: 3:55 pm
from Deft regarding statement
Sentencing hearing on January 20, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
States proposed offer

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:34 am 
INCLUDES 15CF1192, 16CF200, 16CF234, 16CF329, 16CF977, AND 16CF978.
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon;  Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF1192: Ct. 1 (1st Degree Child Sex Assault/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer and amend to 2nd Degree Child Sex Assault pursuant to 948.02(2). 
In 16CF200: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
In 16CF234: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 16CF329: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 16CF977: Cts. 1-4 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
In 16CF978: Cts. 1-4 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF1192: Amended Ct. 1 (2nd Degree Child Sex Assault)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF200: Amended Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI to be prepared and filed by the Court no later than 6 weeks from today's date. 
Sentencing Hearing set for 1/20/2017 at 2:30 pm in Br. 3. 

State moves to withdraw motion to forfeit bond. 
COURT grants. 
COURT revokes bond and remands deft into custody of MCSD pending sentencing. 
COURT directs any cash bond posted to be returned to the poster.
